Treatment consists of an antibiotic eye drop or ointment for 8 days. In cases resistant to treatment or in encysted forms, incision at the free edge may be necessary. This is carried out under local anaesthetic on an outpatient basis.

question.title: Treatment for a stye
question.description: The treatment for a stye, also known as a hordeolum, typically involves the use of antibiotics.

option_a.title: Antibiotic eye drops
option_a.description: For mild cases, antibiotic eye drops may be prescribed.

option_b.title: Incision and drainage
option_b.description: In cases resistant to treatment or encysted forms, incision at the free edge may be necessary.

option_c.title: Local anaesthetic
option_c.description: Under local anaesthetic, the procedure is carried out on an outpatient basis.

option_d.title: Surgical excision
option_d.description: Surgical excision may be necessary in severe cases or when the stye is encysted.

correct_option.title: Antibiotic eye drops
correct_option.description: For mild cases, antibiotic eye drops may be prescribed.
